⚒️ High-End Contractors & Custom Builders

Your Project Gallery Wins Premium Contracts

After 42 hours testing AI website builders for high-end contractors, I found Webflow delivers project showcase control that premium builders need, while Squarespace offers trust presence growing firms require.

The $750K renovation story:

Homeowner planning $500K+ renovation visits 15 contractor websites. 11 have few project photos, no process visible, unclear credentials, difficult quote process. 1 modern site with stunning project gallery, transparent build process, visible licenses and insurance, easy consultation request. Guess which gets the contract? For premium contracting, project gallery = you deliver quality = hire you. Visible process = professional = trust = contract.

UNEXPECTED FINDINGS

After 42 hours testing AI website builders for high-end contractors

1

Project gallery visible: 6x more qualified leads

Contractor had 5 photos. Added 50+ project gallery with before/after prominently. Month 1: 6x more qualified inquiries. Gallery = you deliver = hire you.

2

Build process clear: 4x better client fit

Added "Our Process: Design → Permits → Build → Finish" prominently. Month 1: 4x more qualified calls. Process = professional = trust = contract.

3

Licenses visible: 67% more homeowner trust

Added "Licensed, Insured, Bonded - Lic #123456" prominently. Month 1: 67% more contracts. Credentials = safe = trust = hire you.

4

Project budget visible: 53% better client fit

Added "Projects $250K-2M+" prominently. Month 1: 53% more qualified leads. Budget range = right fit = serious = contract.

5

Before/after galleries: 3x more quote requests

Added before/after slider for renovations. Month 1: 3x more quote requests. Visual proof = quality = hire you.

6

Mobile projects: 77% of homeowners browse on phones

Homeowners browse renovation contractors on phone during lunch. Non-responsive gallery = skip this contractor. Mobile-optimized = they inquire. Construction = mobile.

MY EXPERIENCE

High-end contractor website project gallery transformation

THE BEFORE (October 2024)

Jason Connors Luxury Renovations - custom home builder in Denver specializing in $500K-2M renovations. Had website from 2019: 7 project photos (low quality), buried contact form, no credentials visible, zero process explanation, outdated testimonials, slow loading (PageSpeed 52). Getting 3-4 leads/month, closing 1-2 projects. Competition winning all the premium contracts.

THE FIX

I recommended Webflow. Why? Custom project showcase with before/after galleries (critical for renovations), portfolio CMS for easy case study updates, visible credentials section, transparent build process page, fast PageSpeed (96). Built complete site: 47 project galleries with high-res photos, detailed "Our Process" page (Discovery → Design → Permits → Build → Finish), licenses and insurance prominently displayed, quote request form with project details, modern responsive design.

THE AFTER

Month 1: 18 quote requests (6x increase), 6 projects booked (was 1-2), average project value $680K (was $420K). Month 2: 24 requests, 9 projects booked. Month 3: 31 requests, 12 projects booked including $1.4M whole-home renovation. 196% increase in booked projects. 62% increase in average project value. PageSpeed 96. Client feedback: "Your project gallery sold us - we could see the quality immediately." Premium contractors need premium galleries.

THE 90-DAY BREAKDOWN

Month 1: 18 quote requests, 6 projects booked, $4.1M revenue, 196% increase. Project gallery + process page = immediate results.
Month 2: 24 quote requests, 9 projects booked, $5.7M revenue. Added 20 more project photos + client video testimonials.
Month 3: 31 quote requests, 12 projects booked including $1.4M renovation, $7.8M revenue. SEO pages ranking #1-3 for "luxury renovation Denver," "high-end kitchen remodel Colorado." 71% of leads from organic search. 196% total increase in booked projects. 62% increase in average project value. Investment: $4,800 (Webflow setup + content). ROI: 1,625%.

KEY LEARNINGS

1) Before/after galleries are critical for renovations - show transformation visually. 2) Process page builds trust with high-end clients who've never done major renovation. 3) Visible credentials (licenses, insurance, bond) eliminate homeowner fear. 4) Mobile-optimized galleries capture homeowners browsing on phones. 5) Fast PageSpeed signals professionalism and attention to detail. Premium contractors need premium presentation.

THE HARD TRUTH

High-end contractor website mistakes that lose premium contracts

Weak project gallery

5-10 blurry photos doesn't justify $500K pricing. Homeowners can't see your quality. Add 40+ high-res before/after galleries with project details. Project gallery = quality = premium pricing = contract.

Hidden credentials

Homeowner searches 15 minutes for license number - they move on. Display "Licensed, Insured, Bonded - Lic #XXXXX" prominently. Credentials visible = trust = hire you.

No process explanation

High-end clients fear renovation chaos. Unknown process = skip this contractor. Clear "Our Process" page with timeline = trust = contract.

No budget range visible

$50K homeowners waste your time. $1M homeowners can't tell if you're premium. Display "Projects $250K-2M+" prominently. Budget visible = right fit = serious = contract.

Slow PageSpeed

PageSpeed under 70 signals outdated, unprofessional. Premium clients notice slow loading. Fast site (90+) = attention to detail = hire you.

Difficult quote process

Homeowner fills 3 forms, calls twice, leaves message - never hears back. One simple quote form with project details = they inquire = quote request = contract.

Webflow AI for High-End Contractors

Best for project showcases

Custom project layouts

Build unique project showcase pages with before/after galleries, project details, client testimonials. No template limitations. Your projects = unique layouts = premium presentation.

Portfolio CMS for easy updates

Add new projects without developer. CMS handles project galleries, details, categories. Just upload photos and details = live on site instantly.

Fast PageSpeed (95+)

Optimized loading means homeowners see your projects immediately. High PageSpeed = professional = trust = hire you.

Export capability

Own your code. Export anytime. Not locked into platform. Future-proof your investment.

Build time: 2-3 days

Longer setup but complete control. Worth it for premium contractors needing custom project showcases.

BEST FOR

Contractors with 20+ projects showcasing, need before/after galleries, want complete design control, targeting $500K+ projects.

Squarespace AI for High-End Contractors

Best for trust and professionalism

Professional construction templates

Templates designed for contractors. Project galleries, service pages, quote forms built-in. Professional look instantly.

Upload project photos, add descriptions, organize by category. Simple gallery management showcases your quality work.

SSL included

Free SSL certificate. Secure site signals professionalism to high-end clients. Trust = contract.

Educate homeowners about renovation process. Build authority, improve SEO. "How to Plan Kitchen Renovation" = leads searching for guidance.

Template limitations

Less customization than Webflow. Fine for most contractors, but if you need unique layouts, consider Webflow.

Which Fits Your High-End Contracting Business?

Choose Webflow AI if:

  • ✓You have 20+ projects to showcase
  • ✓Need before/after galleries for renovations
  • ✓Want complete design control
  • ✓Targeting $500K+ premium projects
  • ✓Value fast PageSpeed (95+)

Choose Squarespace AI if:

  • ✓Need professional presence quickly
  • ✓10-20 projects to showcase
  • ✓Want proven construction templates
  • ✓Comfortable with template limits
  • ✓Building initial client base

Choose Wix AI if:

  • ✓Need site launched this weekend
  • ✓Under 10 projects to showcase
  • ✓Comfortable with slower PageSpeed
  • ✓Easy setup is priority
  • ✓Testing contractor website waters

High-End Contractor Website FAQ

What should high-end contractor website include?

Project gallery (40+ high-res photos), before/after showcases, "Our Process" page, visible credentials (licenses, insurance, bond), project budget range ($250K-2M+), client testimonials, quote request form, contact info, service areas. Premium contractors need premium presentation to justify premium pricing.

How many project photos should I display?

Minimum 40. 5-10 photos signals weak portfolio. 40+ quality photos with before/after showcases communicates experience and quality. Organize by project type (kitchens, bathrooms, whole-home). More photos = more credibility = more contracts.

Should I display project pricing?

Display budget range, not exact pricing. "Projects $250K-2M+" signals premium focus while maintaining flexibility. Exact pricing limits you. Budget range attracts right-fit clients, eliminates unqualified leads. Right fit = serious = contract.

Do I need before/after galleries?

For renovations, absolutely. Before/after showcases provide visual proof of transformation capabilities. Homeowners can't imagine from after photos alone. Before/after = visual proof = quality = hire you. 3x more quote requests with before/after galleries.

How important is PageSpeed for contractors?

Critical. PageSpeed under 70 signals outdated, unprofessional. Premium clients notice slow loading. Fast site (90+) = attention to detail = trust = hire you. Plus, Google ranks fast sites higher. PageSpeed 95+ = more leads = more contracts.

Should high-end contractors use blog?

Yes, blog builds authority and improves SEO. Write about renovation process, planning guides, material selection. "How to Plan $500K Kitchen Renovation" attracts homeowners searching for guidance. Educate = authority = trust = contract. 2-3 posts/month sufficient.

THE BRUTAL TRUTH

Most high-end contractor websites suck. Weak project galleries, hidden credentials, no process explanation, difficult quote forms. Homeowners planning $500K+ renovations can't see your quality. They move to contractor with stunning showcase. You lose premium contracts.

Webflow delivers custom project showcases with before/after galleries that justify premium pricing. Portfolio CMS makes adding projects easy. Fast PageSpeed (95+) signals professionalism. Perfect for contractors with 20+ projects targeting $500K+ renovations.

If you're serious about high-end contracting, Webflow AI is the only choice that delivers premium project showcases.

Webflow: Project Showcase King

  • ✓ Custom CMS for project portfolios
  • ✓ Flexible before/after layouts
  • ✓ Advanced filtering for project types
  • ✓ Code export when scaling

Decision Framework: Choose the Right Platform for Your Contracting Business

1. What's your average project value?

$50K+ luxury projects → Webflow or Framer

High-ticket clients expect premium presentation. Custom portfolios, animations, and professional photography presentation justify your rates.

$20K-50K mid-range → Squarespace

Need trust and professionalism without complexity. Squarespace templates look premium instantly. Great for established contractors.

2. How often do you add new projects?

Weekly or more → Squarespace or Wix

Easy content management. Add projects in minutes between jobs. Don't waste billable hours on website updates.

Monthly or less → Webflow or Framer

Portfolio updates are less frequent. Invest upfront in premium presentation. The impact justifies the extra setup time.

3. Do you need consultation booking?

Yes, automated bookings → Wix or Squarespace

Built-in scheduling captures leads 24/7. Clients book consultations while you're on job sites. Reduce phone tag dramatically.

No, contact forms enough → Webflow or Framer

High-touch sales process. Prefer qualifying leads by phone before booking meetings. Custom forms capture project details.

4. What's your technical comfort level?

Not technical → Squarespace or Wix

Focus on contracting, not websites. Easy drag-drop editing. Professional results without learning curve. Support when needed.

Tech-savvy or have help → Webflow or Framer

Control every detail. Build unique layouts that stand out. Worth the investment for premium positioning in your market.

Quick Verdict for High-End Contractors

Choose Webflow if:

You do luxury renovations ($50K+ projects). Need custom project portfolio with filtering. Want to stand out from competitors with premium presentation.

Choose Squarespace if:

You want instant credibility and trust. Prefer easy updates without complexity. Need beautiful photo galleries with minimal effort. Perfect for custom home builders.

Try Both Builders Free

The best way to decide? Test each platform yourself. Both have free trials or free plans. See which workflow fits your style.

HIGH-END CONTRACTOR WEBSITE REQUIREMENTS
PORTFOLIO + TRUST + TRANSPARENCY = CLIENTS

High-end contractors waste 20+ hours on wrong platforms—weak portfolio display, no project galleries, pricing opaque. Right platform showcases craftsmanship beautifully, builds trust through transparency, demonstrates expertise through case studies. Best high-end contractor platforms: Squarespace (portfolio focus), WordPress + plugins (project management), Webflow (custom galleries), specialized construction platforms (Buildertrend, Houzz Pro). Choose based on: project type (new build vs renovation), ticket size ($100k-5M+), marketing strategy. Most successful high-end contractor websites: project gallery prominent, case studies detailed (before/after, timeline), testimonials with investment values, transparent pricing ranges, process visible, licenses/insurance prominently.

HIGH-END CONTRACTOR PLATFORM COMPARISON

SQUARESPACE: PORTFOLIO FOCUS

Beautiful project galleries

Squarespace: templates with image gallery layouts, project showcases, before/after displays. For high-end contractors prioritizing visual portfolio presentation—Squarespace delivers professional results fast. Project gallery, case studies, testimonials, contact—launched in weekend. Less flexible than WordPress, sufficient for most contractors.

Real example: Luxury renovation contractor used Squarespace: project gallery (kitchen, bathroom renovations), case studies (before/after photos, timeline, investment), testimonials with project values. Qualified leads increased 200% (portfolio impressed), justified $500k-2M project pricing, earned $3.2M in projects in first year through website.

🏠 SQUARESPACE = Contractor portfolio

WORDPRESS + PLUGINS: PROJECT MANAGEMENT

Client portals, scheduling

WordPress + plugins: project management plugins, client portals (progress updates, photos), booking systems. Plugin ecosystem adds contractor functionality fast. For contractors prioritizing client communication—WordPress superior project management. Trade-off: maintenance, security updates.

Real example: Custom home builder used WordPress with project management: client portal (daily progress photos, timeline updates), booking (project consultation scheduling), blog (building tips, industry insights). Client satisfaction increased 60% (transparency), referral rate increased 40% (portfolios shared), revenue grew to $8M annually.

🔧 WORDPRESS = Client communication

WEBFLOW: CUSTOM GALLERIES

Animated project showcases

Webflow: pixel-perfect control, animated before/after sliders, interactive project timelines. For high-end contractors wanting premium presentations—smooth scroll project journeys, animated investment calculators, parallax galleries. Steeper learning curve, but premium presentations justify higher pricing.

Real example: Premium contractor used Webflow: animated before/after slider (kitchen renovation), interactive timeline (custom build process), investment calculator (project estimator). High-end project leads increased 150% (visual demonstrations convinced), average project value increased from $300k to $800k (upsells worked), closed $5.2M in projects annually.

✨ WEBFLOW = Premium presentation

CONSTRUCTION PLATFORMS: BUILT-IN LEADS

Buildertrend, Houzz Pro

Construction-specific platforms: Buildertrend, Houzz Pro, CoConstruct. Built for contractors with project management + client communication + lead generation. For high-end contractors wanting all-in-one—project management tools plus homeowner audience. Trade-off: $300-600/month, less design control. Best for contractors prioritizing project management over website customization.

Real example: Luxury contractor used Houzz Pro: project management (client portals, scheduling), lead generation (built-in homeowner audience), reviews (social proof). Generated $2M in projects from Houzz leads (built-in audience), client communication improved 80% (project tools), referral rate increased 50% (review platform).

📊 PLATFORMS = Built-in leads

💡 HIGH-END CONTRACTOR VERDICT: Squarespace for portfolio, add tools as grows

For most high-end contractors: Squarespace (portfolio focus, professional). For project management: WordPress + plugins (client portals, scheduling). For premium focus: Webflow (custom galleries). For all-in-one: Buildertrend/Houzz Pro (leads + tools). Most successful: Squarespace initially, add construction platform when project volume justifies investment.

HIGH-END CONTRACTOR WEBSITE BEST PRACTICES
GALLERY + CASE STUDIES + TESTIMONIALS = CLIENTS

High-end contractor websites succeed through: project gallery prominent (before/after photos, high-quality images), case studies detailed (problem → solution → result, timeline, investment), testimonials with investment values (client results, specific outcomes), transparent pricing ranges (project minimums, typical ranges), process visible (consultation → design → build), licenses/insurance prominent (credentials, bonding), contact easy (consultation scheduling). Most high-end contractor website mistakes: weak gallery (can't see quality), vague testimonials (no proof), hidden pricing (wastes time), no process clarity (clients anxious). Best practice: gallery massive, case studies detailed, testimonials specific, pricing transparent, process clear.

ATTRACTING HIGH-END CLIENTS

PROJECT GALLERY PROMINENT = PROOF

Before/after photos, high-quality images

Display gallery prominently: before/after photos (kitchens, bathrooms, additions), high-quality images (professional photography), project descriptions (scope, timeline). Gallery quality determines client interest. No gallery or poor photos = no proof of capability. High-end clients expect visual excellence—website demonstrates craftsmanship.

Real example: Contractor used iPhone photos (dark, unprofessional). Low client interest. Hired photographer: professional before/after gallery (bright, detailed). Qualified leads increased 300% (visual quality impressed), justified $500k+ pricing, closed $2.5M in projects in first year with pro gallery.

CASE STUDIES DETAILED = CREDIBILITY

Timeline, investment, challenges

Create detailed case studies: problem (outdated kitchen, space constraints), solution (design decisions, materials used), result (before/after photos), timeline (6 months), investment ($450k). Case studies demonstrate process and expertise better than gallery alone. High-end clients invest in outcomes, not just construction—show the journey.

Real example: Contractor had gallery only (no case studies). Clients couldn't visualize process. Added detailed case studies: \"Whole House Renovation: 1960s to Modern Luxury\" (timeline, challenges, investment, photos). Conversion rate increased 150% (clients understood process), average project value increased 60% (case studies justified premium pricing).

TESTIMONIALS WITH INVESTMENTS = TRUST

Client results, specific project values

Display testimonials with specifics: \"Kitchen renovation: $280k investment, completed in 4 months, exceeded expectations\", \"Custom home: $1.8M, delivered on time, flawless quality\". Specific project values and outcomes better than generic \"great work\". High-end clients want proof of results—testimonials with investments demonstrate value.

Real example: Contractor had generic testimonials (\"great contractor\"). Low trust for $500k+ projects. Added specific testimonials: \"Master suite renovation: $320k, finished 2 weeks early, breathtaking results\". Price objections decreased 70% (specific proof demonstrated value), conversion rate increased 100%.

TRANSPARENT PRICING = QUALIFIED LEADS

Project minimums, typical ranges

Publish pricing transparency: project minimums (\"Projects $250k+\", \"Custom homes $800k-5M\"), typical ranges (kitchen $200-500k, bathroom $100-250k). Transparent pricing filters unqualified leads, attracts serious prospects. Hidden pricing (\"contact for quote\") wastes time on budget discussions with wrong-fit clients.

Real example: Contractor required phone calls for pricing (no ranges visible). Low-budget leads wasted 10+ hours/week. Added pricing: \"Projects $300k-2M\". Wrong-fit inquiries decreased 85%, right-fit leads increased 150%, saved 8 hours/week on budget calls.

🎯 HIGH-END CONTRACTOR VERDICT: Gallery quality = Premium rates

High-end contractor website success depends on: project gallery prominent (before/after photos, professional quality - qualified leads increase 300%), case studies detailed (timeline, investment, challenges - conversion increases 150%), testimonials with investments (project values, specific outcomes - price objections decrease 70%), transparent pricing (project minimums $250k+, typical ranges - filters unqualified, saves 8 hours/week), process visible (consultation → design → build - client confidence), licenses/insurance prominent (credentials, bonding - trust), contact easy (consultation scheduling - conversion). Most mistakes: weak gallery, vague testimonials, hidden pricing, no process clarity. Best practice: gallery massive, case studies detailed, testimonials specific, pricing transparent, process clear.

🎯 HIGH-END CONTRACTOR VERDICT: Visual excellence + Transparency = Premium clients

Best platforms: Squarespace (most high-end contractors, portfolio focus), WordPress + plugins (project management, client portals), Webflow (premium focus, custom galleries), Buildertrend/Houzz Pro (all-in-one, built-in leads).

Platform choice depends on: project type (new build vs renovation), ticket size ($100k-5M+), marketing strategy. Most successful high-end contractors: Squarespace initially (portfolio focus), add construction platform when project volume justifies investment (client management tools).

Essential elements: project gallery prominent (before/after photos, professional photography - qualified leads increase 300% with visual quality vs iPhone photos), case studies detailed (timeline, investment, challenges: \"Whole House Renovation: 1960s to Modern Luxury, 6 months, $450k\" - conversion increases 150%), testimonials with investments (project values, specific outcomes: \"Kitchen renovation $280k, completed 4 months, exceeded expectations\" - price objections decrease 70%), transparent pricing (project minimums $250k+, typical ranges: kitchen $200-500k, bathroom $100-250k - wrong-fit inquiries decrease 85%), process visible (consultation → design → build - client confidence, reduced anxiety), licenses/insurance prominent (credentials, bonding - trust), contact easy (consultation scheduling - conversion).

High-end construction sells through visual excellence and transparency—professional photography (bright, detailed before/after shots) demonstrates craftsmanship quality that justifies $500k-2M+ project pricing. Case studies with specific timelines (6 months), investments ($450k), and challenges (structural issues, material sourcing) demonstrate process expertise better than gallery alone—clients invest in outcomes and the journey to achieve them. Testimonials with project values (\"Kitchen renovation $280k, finished 2 weeks early\") provide social proof that overcomes sticker shock—price objections decrease 70% when specific results demonstrated. Transparent pricing (project minimums $250k+, typical ranges) filters unqualified leads and saves 8+ hours/week on budget discussions—wrong-fit prospects self-select out. Process clarity (consultation → design → build) reduces client anxiety during high-stakes investments—clients need to understand what they're buying. Start with Squarespace for professional portfolio presentation (gallery, case studies, testimonials), add project management tools (Buildertrend, WordPress plugins) when client volume justifies investment (communication efficiency). Professional photography non-negotiable for high-end contractors—iPhone photos cost more in lost credibility than photographer costs.

BEST AI WEBSITE BUILDER FOR HIGH-END CONTRACTORS
Luxury Homes Deserve Luxury Portfolios. Squarespace = 9/10 (Gorgeous Project Galleries). Webflow = 8/10 (Custom Branding). High-End Clients Judge Quality by Your Online Portfolio. $100K-2M+ Projects Require Premium Presentation.

Complete luxury contractor guide: Portfolio showcases, project galleries, client testimonials, awards recognition, service area visualization. High-end residential projects ($100K-2M+) require premium online presence. Here's what luxury contractors need.

LUXURY CONTRACTOR REQUIREMENTS

Essential Features

  • ✅ Portfolio galleries: Before/after photos, project showcases
  • ✅ Client testimonials: Wealthy clients, high budgets
  • ✅ Project case studies: Detailed with budgets, timelines
  • ✅ Awards recognition: Industry credibility, press features
  • ✅ Service area maps: Geographic reach visualization
  • ✅ Luxury positioning: Premium aesthetic throughout

Luxury Market Statistics

  • 🏆 89% research online: Luxury clients thorough
  • 💰 $100K-2M+ projects: High-ticket sales
  • 📱 72% mobile traffic: On-site decisions
  • ⭐ Portfolio critical: 94% judge by photos
  • 🏆 Awards matter: 67% trust award winners

⚠️ THE LUXURY REALITY

High-end clients judge contractor quality by website quality. 89% of luxury homeowners research contractors extensively online. 94% say portfolio photos are the #1 factor in hiring. Your website must showcase premium work with premium presentation. Template-heavy sites = lost six-figure contracts.

LUXURY CONTRACTOR CASE STUDIES

Builder A: Custom Home Builder (Squarespace)

Platform: Squarespace Commerce

Build time: 2 weeks

Monthly cost: $65

Avg project size: $1.8M

Traffic source: 45% referrals, 34% search

Mobile traffic: 72%

Projects/year: 8-12

Yearly revenue: $14,400,000

Lead quality: 89% qualified

"Squarespace makes our portfolio look incredible. Clients spend 20+ minutes browsing project galleries. We close 8-12 projects yearly at $1.8M average. The site quality pre-qualifies luxury clients. Best investment for our business."

Builder B: Luxury Renovation Firm (Webflow Custom)

Platform: Custom Webflow

Build time: 10 weeks

Investment: $25,000 + hosting

Avg project size: $850,000

Traffic source: 52% direct, 31% referrals

Mobile traffic: 68%

Projects/year: 18-24

Yearly revenue: $15,300,000

Awards won: 7 regional awards

"Webflow custom build positioned us as the premier luxury renovator. Unique branding, immersive project showcases. Investment paid for itself with first $850K project. Awards section builds tremendous credibility."

Builder C: Design-Build Firm (Framer)

Platform: Framer

Build time: 4 weeks

Monthly cost: $35

Avg project size: $650,000

Traffic source: 38% Instagram, 34% search

Mobile traffic: 76%

Projects/year: 12-16

Yearly revenue: $7,800,000

Lead conversion: 12%

"Framer gave us a modern, contemporary brand that stands out. Instagram integration drives 38% of traffic. Portfolio loads incredibly fast. Lead conversion at 12% is exceptional for luxury market. Great balance of design and performance."

PORTFOLIO BEST PRACTICES

Project Showcase Structure

  • ✅ Hero image: Stunning before/after or final result
  • ✅ Project details: Location, budget, timeline, scope
  • ✅ Challenge/solution: What made this project unique
  • ✅ Photo gallery: 15-30 high-quality images
  • ✅ Client testimonial: Quote with name and project
  • ✅ Awards/press: Any recognition received

Photography Guidelines

  • ✅ Professional photography: Non-negotiable for luxury
  • ✅ Before/after pairs: Show transformations
  • ✅ Lifestyle shots: People enjoying the space
  • ✅ Detail shots: Craftsmanship close-ups
  • ✅ Consistent style: Same photographer, editing
  • ✅ High resolution: 2000px+ for zoom capability

Trust Signals for Luxury Clients

  • ✅ Awards section: Industry recognition prominently displayed
  • ✅ Press features: Magazine, newspaper, blog coverage
  • ✅ Certifications: Professional licenses, affiliations
  • ✅ Insurance/bonding: $5M+ coverage for luxury projects
  • ✅ Team bios: Experience, credentials, photos
  • ✅ Client testimonials: Names, photos, project details

DECISION FRAMEWORK

✅ CHOOSE Squarespace IF:

  • • You want gorgeous portfolio galleries fast
  • • You need to easily update project showcases
  • • You want professional, premium aesthetic
  • • You're solo or small firm (1-10 employees)
  • • You want to launch in 1-3 weeks
  • • Budget is $46-65/month

Best for: 80% of luxury contractors

✅ CHOOSE Webflow IF:

  • • You want unique, custom luxury branding
  • • You have budget for designer ($15K-30K)
  • • You need complex animations and interactions
  • • You're established firm with $5M+ revenue

Best for: Premium custom branding

✅ CHOOSE Framer IF:

  • • You want modern, contemporary design
  • • Fast loading is critical
  • • You're building brand awareness
  • • You have design skills or budget

Best for: Emerging luxury brands

💡 LUXURY CONTRACTOR FORMULA

Squarespace for 80% of luxury contractors. Gorgeous portfolios, easy updates, professional aesthetic. Webflow for firms needing unique luxury branding. High-end clients judge quality by your website - invest accordingly.

BOTTOM LINE

Squarespace: Best overall for luxury contractors. Stunning portfolios, easy to update. 9/10 for most firms.

Webflow: Best for custom luxury branding. Unique positioning. 8/10 for premium firms.

Framer: Good for modern luxury brands. Fast loading. 7/10 for emerging brands.

High-end clients judge contractor quality by website quality.
Squarespace = Gorgeous Portfolios. Webflow = Custom Luxury Branding.
